sentence.Network_en: Carol is a tall, dark, Latin type of woman.
sentence.Network_cn: 卡萝尔身材高大，黑发棕肤，是个有着拉丁风情的女子。

sentence.Network_en: Latin and Greek will be squeezed out of school timetables.
sentence.Network_cn: 拉丁语和希腊语将退出学校的课程表。

sentence.Network_en: Above its doors was a Latin inscription: Non omnia possumus omnes.
sentence.Network_cn: 门的上方刻有拉丁文铭“人非万能”。

PerfectNetExp.abs: He is a stranger to Latin.他不懂拉丁文.

entry.def: Latin is the language which the ancient Romans used to speak.

entry.tran: （国家）操拉丁系语言的；拉丁语系国家的
entry.def: Latin countries are countries where Spanish, or perhaps Portuguese, Italian, or French, is spoken. You can also use Latin to refer to things and people that come from these countries.

example.ex: Cuba was one of the least Catholic of the Latin countries...
example.tran: 古巴是拉丁语系国家中天主教化程度最小的国家之一。

example.ex: The enthusiasm for Latin music is worldwide.
example.tran: 全球掀起拉丁音乐热潮。

entry.def: Latins are people who come from countries where Spanish, or perhaps Portuguese, Italian, or French, are spoken or whose families come from one of these countries.

example.ex: They are role models for thousands of young Latins.
example.tran: 他们是千万拉丁青年的榜样。

means.word_mean: 1. any dialect of the language of ancient Rome
3. a person who is a member of those peoples whose languages derived from Latin
1. of or relating to the ancient Latins or the Latin language;
2. having or resembling the psychology or temper characteristic of people of Latin America;
3. relating to people or countries speaking Romance languages;
4. relating to languages derived from Latin;
5. of or relating to the ancient region of Latium;

Sentence.sentence: Early slaves were generally denied education, but Wheatley was allowed by her owner to study poetry, Latin and the Bible.

sentences.cn: 19世纪凡是受过教育的人在拉丁语和希腊语方面都有很好的基础。
